Key Match Events: Goalkeeper Lawrence Mulenga spilled a cross from Achraf Hakimi and Hakim Ziyech reacted quickest in the goalmouth and slammed the loose ball into the net.
Pre-Game Insights: Morocco were playing their 73rd match and Zambia a 70th in the flagship African competition, but this was only the third time they have met with the Atlas Lions previously winning and drawing.
Post-Match Reflections: The Royal Moroccan Football Federation said they will appeal the suspension, calling it an 'incomprehensible decision (as) Regragui did not... contravene the spirit of fair play'.
Zambia coach and former Chelsea and West Ham United manager Avram Grant introduced Sakala and Kangwa, hoping they could boost chances of an equaliser.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Morocco's midfielder #7 Hakim Ziyech (R) celebrates with Morocco's defender #5 Nayef Aguerd after scoring his team's first goal during the Africa Cup of Nations (CAN) 2024 group F football match between Zambia and Morocco at the Stade Laurent Pokou in San Pedro on January 24, 2024.
Morocco coach Walid Regragui watched the match from the stand after being banned for two matches following a post-match clash with DR Congo captain Chancel Mbemba on Sunday.
Others: Ivory Coast, humbled 4-0 by Equatorial Guinea on Monday, were among the four highest-ranked third-placed teams who qualified.
Morocco will face South Africa in the round of 16 while runners-up the Democratic Republic of Congo, who drew 0-0 with Tanzania, face Egypt.
